newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities closed narrowly mixed on Wednesday in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said.
"The market is bullish today. Traders are awaiting the overnight bank rate situation and whether it will stay (at current levels)," said a local dealer.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at 2.83/2.78 percent compared to Tuesday's 2.88/2.83 percent and one-year at 2.72/2.67 percent against the previous 2.75/2.70 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 ended at S$98.55/98.60 compared with Tuesday's S$98.50/98.55, September 2001 at S$96.40/96.50 against S$96.45/96.55 and June 2003 at S$94.23/94.28 from S$94.13/94.18.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased 6/8 points to 3-1/8 3 percent versus Tuesday's 3-7/8 3-3/4 percent.
